name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: What do the country's great dynasties reveal about how modern Chinese leaders may wield their power? Look to their policies and practices, @MichaelSchuman writes: https://t.co/J9XlY0XIkh

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: .@olgakhazan + @russellberman: "That day at the White House could have sent the virus spreading. Or the virus could already have been rampant." https://t.co/Xk0mfW8oh0

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose boyfriend is jealous that she still values memories from her first marriage. https://t.co/ijfmthhdy3

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "America became a more untrustworthy society.... under the stresses of 2020, American institutions and the American social order crumbled and were revealed as more untrustworthy still." Great new essay from @nytdavidbrooks:
https://t.co/T8HMYqVQPv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Asking whether the celebration of Amy Coney Barrett's nomination was a "super-spreader" event misses the point: Trump's irresponsibility made this crisis likely, @olgakhazan and @russellberman write: https://t.co/NKkwg3ZCvc

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: Failure, cheat, or criminal: 3 interpretations of what Trump's tax records are telling us about his business—and his possible charges if he becomes a private citizen in 2021.

https://t.co/dmbH8S97kG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: "A new culture is dawning. The Age of Precarity is here.”

Read @nytdavidbrooks on our moral convulsion:

https://t.co/sQ3Y2rV7DP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @SStossel: "I’ve spent my career rebutting the idea that America is in decline, but the events of these past six years, and especially of 2020, have made clear that we live in a broken nation. The cancer of distrust has spread to every vital organ." https://t.co/1popucVhVi

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: Was the Rose Garden ceremony a super-spreader event? Maybe. But Trump and co have been acting irresponsibly about their own COVID-19 risk for months now https://t.co/kixZd8zPQ9

name: TheAtlantic
text: Levels of trust in America—in our institutions, in our politics, and in one another—are in precipitous decline. And when social trust collapses, nations fail. Can we get it back before it’s too late? @nytdavidbrooks on America’s moral convulsion: https://t.co/kOeOpEwNfe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump is not, and never was, Richard III, or indeed any of Shakespeare’s other great villains, such as Iago or Macbeth," writes @EliotACohen: https://t.co/q6e71s7kHf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AnnHulbert1: Fear, @rebeccagiggs explains, represents "an evolutionary high-wire act" for all animals, including humans: The ability to identify the right things to be afraid of is crucial. https://t.co/R5xuiwYoLc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: California: Images of the Golden State - the 39th in a year-long photo series, focusing on each of the 50 states in the United States of America. https://t.co/mSmmfqsZWn https://t.co/1FytHgkvWF

name: TheAtlantic
text: "How North Carolina voters respond to the Cunningham texts could provide some hint of whether, in the Trump era, such a vanilla scandal makes any difference," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/6v7lSNHSGf

name: TheAtlantic
text: "How exactly has a self-declared billionaire avoided federal taxation for the better part of this century? Do these records prove that he’s poor, or astonishingly good at hiding how rich he is?" @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/eoWWygykCO

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Can you talk in my ear very closely so I can make sure it’s you?” For "The Friendship Files," @julieebeck talks with a group of friends about what it was like to meet a friend they knew only through video-game voice chat: https://t.co/gZRpPm4v1g

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Kayleigh McEnany, the White House press secretary,  has tested positive for COVID-19.

Trump’s irresponsibility made the outbreak among GOP officials likely, @olgakhazan and @russellberman wrote earlier this morning. https://t.co/oKdhF0jsWM

text: RT @prashantrao: "That distant referendum in Chile offers the U.S. an example of how ordinary people can, through peaceful mobilization and decisive action, save their republic from an authoritarian figure," Ariel Dorfman writes: https://t.co/8f5uiOZALt

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @LoriGottlieb1: “To love you is to embrace your entire story—not to dictate that you edit parts of it out. If your boyfriend can’t honor all of you—including your past—you’ll have a hard time creating a future together."

Today ⁦@TheAtlantic⁩ : The ex’s photos  https://t.co/8C85id4xiC

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The ability to identify the right things to be afraid of is a heritable trait in some species,” @rebeccagiggs writes. “Where does the line fall between instinctive fears and those acquired via culture?” https://t.co/YvWLD1XZRe
